cyclone.name: EMILY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving east across the central Florida peninsula today, then accelerating northeast and remaining offshore of the Georgia–South Carolina coast while heading toward the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Florida peninsula near the Tampa Bay area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Anclote River to Englewood, Florida (west-central FL Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: west-central Florida coast, central Florida interior, and Atlantic waters offshore Florida, Georgia, and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible with occasional gusts below tropical-storm force; overall wind threat remains low (≤34-kt probability only 3%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast because the system remains well offshore while relatively weak.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rainfall (generally 1–2 inches) possible late Tuesday into Wednesday as the depression passes offshore.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor coastal rip currents and higher offshore seas could briefly affect vessel approaches but no significant port-level hazards expected.
